Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Non drinker
Regular exercise
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Inegy , Loratadine , Avamys
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Inegy , Loratadine , Avamys
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Inegy , Loratadine , Avamys
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Inegy , Loratadine , Avamys

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Women's Health Recommendations:

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Report Date: 2020-09-15

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your back pain sounds muscular. Please consult with a physio and then consider an xray if not improving
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation

Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and triglycerides
Mildly raised ALT liver enzyme

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and triglycerides
Mildly raised ALT liver enzyme
Back pain
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Report Date: 2020-09-15

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Mild neutrophilia and eosinophilia, probably due to asthma and corticosteroid therapy, mildly raised ALT liver enzyme and total cholesterol and triglycerides
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Women's Health Recommendations:

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Overview Notes: Hypercholesterolemia on medication
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation

Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Continue managing your chronic conditions as you have. Optimising your lifestyle and remaining compliant to your medication will keep these conditions under good control.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Continue managing your chronic conditions as you have. Optimising your lifestyle and remaining compliant to your medication will keep these conditions under good control.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.

Women's Health Recommendations:

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your back pain sounds muscular. Please consult with a physio and then consider an xray if not improving
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations:

Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: All within normal limits
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations:

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Red throat with evidence of thrush due to inhaler usage. Ensure that you rinse your mouth afterwards and consider opening your probiotic capsule into some water or yogurt and swirling around your mouth before swallowing.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your back pain sounds muscular. Please consult with a physio and then consider an xray if not improving

Employee: Erwin Pon

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

------------------------------
Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Mildly raised ALT could be due to taking crestor or due to a fatty infiltration of the liver. The level is very marginally raised so just pay attention to all the above advice and then monitor the level at your next check up.
Comment Key: WomensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations:

Mildly raised ALT liver enzyme

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Continue taking 5mg of Crestor but also pay attention to your diet. Try to avoid the late night snacking and too many carbohydrates or sugar. Supplement with 2g of omega 3 daily and consider adding rychol.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.

Employee: Erwin Pon
Report Date: 2020-09-15
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to urinary symptoms such as difficulty urinating, frequently urinating, terminal dribbling & poor sexual function. These are some of the signs of prostate disease.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: High CRP indicates high levels of inflammation and falls into high risk category for heart disease. Try and address all causes of inflammation. Avoid allergens, reduce stress and follow an anti - inflammatory mediterranean style diet. Consider taking anti-inflammatory supplements such as omega 3 fish oil and curcumin.
Comment Key: WomensHealthRecommendation
